state_counsel.argument_1: Preventive measures under sections 107 and 151 of the Code of Criminal Procedure are not offences under the Pakistan Penal Code, hence cannot be compounded under section 345, Cr. P. C.
state_counsel.argument_2: Section 494, Cr. P. C does not apply to proceedings under Chapter VIII; proceedings under section 107, Cr. P. C. can only be terminated under section 119, Cr. P. C.
state_counsel.case_reference: The King v. Ba Khin and others (AIR 1940 Rang. 189)

petitioner_counsel.argument_1: Failed to counter the arguments presented by the State counsel.
petitioner_counsel.argument_2: Claimed apprehension of unfair trial due to Magistrate's refusal to accept sureties initially, but this argument was deemed without merit.

judgment_summary.reasoning: The objections raised against the procedure adopted by the Assistant Commissioner were found to be without force, and the apprehension of unfair trial was deemed baseless.
